translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Tuvara
I saw the God of Gods,
With my beak I picked up a lion,
I placed it on the Buddha,
Tissa, the Kinsman of the World.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
there were seven with the name Kesara;
I have done what the Buddha’s instruction requires.”🔽Thus the elder Naḷinakesari recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā naḷinakesariyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Naḷinakesariyattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
